items.title: Matt Painter breaks down Purdue’s point guard play heading into the season
items.snippet: Painter says tempo, decisions in ball screens, and late-clock poise are the difference between good and elite.

items.title: Early rotation notes: Which freshmen are already in the mix for Painter?
items.snippet: Length on the wing and rim protection are the themes so far, with Painter hinting at an 8-9 man core.

items.title: Purdue’s identity without last year’s star big man
items.snippet: Why the offense will shift more perimeter-side and what that means for Painter’s halfcourt sets.

items.title: Boilermakers set date for Mackey Midnight Madness
items.snippet: Fan event will include player intros, scrimmage action and a 3-point contest.

items.title: Way-too-early Big Ten tiers: Where does Purdue land?
items.snippet: Veteran guard play and physical defense keep the Boilers high in the preseason stack.

items.title: Film room: How Purdue wants to defend the pick-and-roll
items.snippet: The staff likes to force tough midrange looks and trust backside rotation instead of giving up rhythm threes.

items.title: Why Braden Smith’s feel is the key to Purdue’s late-game offense
items.snippet: He’s running more empty-side actions and reading weakside help like a veteran pro.

items.title: Can Purdue finally cash it in March?
items.snippet: The conversation isn’t about making the tournament — it’s about cutting nets.
